cards.title: Suggest Features
cards.description: Have an idea for something Arctyll should add? We’re always listening. Whether it’s a feature, tool, or tweak, your feedback matters.

cards.title: Test & Review
cards.description: Help us identify bugs, improve UX, and make sure everything runs smoothly before public release.

cards.title: Contribute Code
cards.description: We occasionally open-source specific tools or components. Check GitHub to see where you can pitch in.

cards.title: Build Tools
cards.description: Have experience in modding, frontend, or backend tools? Dive into active dev work or help us architect something new.

cards.title: Translate Arctyll
cards.description: Help us translate UI, messages, and texts into your language. It helps Arctyll reach more people.

cards.title: Design UI
cards.description: If you’re a designer, your UX/UI input is gold. Improve layout, flow, or visuals in live projects.

faqs.question: Is Arctyll open-source?
faqs.answer: Only partially. Some tools are public on GitHub, but others remain private due to security and stability concerns.

faqs.question: Do I need to know Minecraft modding?
faqs.answer: Not at all. While some projects involve Forge, most of Arctyll’s ecosystem revolves around software tools, web tech, and utilities.

faqs.question: Can I help without coding?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Testing, design feedback, writing, translation — all of that is super helpful.

faqs.question: How do I officially join the team?
faqs.answer: Start by contributing through the public projects or reaching out via the contact page. We notice consistent, thoughtful contributions.

faqs.question: How do I report a bug or issue?
faqs.answer: Use the contact page or open an issue on GitHub if the project is public. Be clear and detailed — it helps us fix things faster.

faqs.question: What skills are most helpful?
faqs.answer: Programming (Java, JS/TS), UI/UX design, localization, and testing are the top areas — but passion and creativity matter most.

faqs.question: What tools do you use internally?
faqs.answer: VS Code, IntelliJ, Vite, React, Forge (1.8.9), GitHub, and Figma — we’re open to new workflows if they improve collaboration.

faqs.question: Can I contribute anonymously?
faqs.answer: Yes, though we encourage consistent identities for proper recognition. Anon feedback and bug reports are always welcome.
